body.text: The Cancer Genome Collaboratory is an academic research cloud that contains the raw and interpreted data from the International Cancer Genome Consortium, an international project that aims to sequence the genomes of 25,000 tumours and matching normal tissues.

pressReleaseLeft.articleTitle: Ontario Institute for Cancer Research uses open source clouds to aid cancer research
pressReleaseLeft.description: Canadian cancer researchers claim that by combining open source software with commodity hardware, they can give academics in the field...
